description: Live from the Democratic National Convention, Voternomics unpacks the policies of the party’s nominee and how much they could cost.
title: What Will a Kamala Harris Economy Look Like?

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green outlines the background tension over Gaza at the Democratic National Convention. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Gaza Conflict Lurks in Background at Democratic Convention

description: The United Center during the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg
title: Democrats Prepare for Kamala Harris Keynote in Chicago

description: The Tennessee Valley Authority approved another $150 million to support advanced nuclear technology as it confronts surging power demand from a growing population.
title: TVA Spending $350 Million to Develop Small Nuclear Reactors

description: Senators in Argentina approved a bill Thursday that defies President Javier Milei’s bid to balance the government’s books by reworking how pension payments are calculated.
title: Argentina Senate Passes New Pension Formula in Defiance of Milei

description: Canada’s railway shutdown will cause billions in dollars in damage to the country’s economy if it’s not resolved quickly, economists say.
title: Rail Shutdown’s Hit to Canada Seen Rising If Outage Lasts a Week

description: Kamala Harris’ campaign strategy for confronting the politically charged issue of the war in Gaza at the Democratic National Convention has been mostly to avoid confronting it at all.
title: Democrats Avoid Gaza Debate in Convention Push to Unify Behind Harris

description: With her keynote speech at the Democratic National Convention on Thursday, Kamala Harris is poised to cement a stunning political transformation: From a vice president whose campaigning and leadership prowess were perpetually doubted by fellow Democrats to a candidate who has taken command of a newly galvanized party.
title: Harris Defies Doubters on Road to Presidential Nomination

description: From the valets parking cars to the dealers at the blackjack tables to the bartenders at the city’s many bars, Las Vegas relies on people working for tips.
title: Vegas Workers Who Live Off Tips Doubt Reality of Tax-Free Pitches

description: Switzerland’s population rose the most in more than half a century, adding to a increasingly tense debate on whether the country should keep the doors open for immigrants.
title: Swiss Population Jumps Most Since 1960s Amid Immigration Tension

description: A crackdown by former UK premier Rishi Sunak’s Conservative government triggered a sharp drop in the number of visas issued to overseas health workers, according to the latest Home Office data, part of a mixed inheritance on immigration for the new Labour administration.
title: Sunak-Era Crackdown Causes Sharp Fall in UK Health Worker Visas

description: Finance Minister Fernando Haddad stated that he will talk with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva this week about the nomination of the next leader of the central bank, according to Valor Economico newspaper. They will also seek to establish a schedule for the appointments of other members to the bank’s board.
title: Brazil’s Lula, Haddad to Discuss Central Bank Succession

description: Thailand needs to urgently tackle its high levels of household and public debt, and focus on policies that can propel the country’s growth rate to match some of its Southeast Asian neighbors, according to former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra.
title: Thaksin Pitches Strategy to Rescue Thailand From Debt Trap

description: The German government has drawn up plans to make it easier to dismiss high earners in the finance industry as the country competes with France and the UK to attract top bankers.
title: Germany Plans to Make It Easier to Fire Finance High Earners

description: Russia is pressing ahead with an offensive in eastern Ukraine even as it struggles to repel a cross-border incursion into its territory by Kyiv’s army.
title: Russian Army Presses On in Ukraine Despite Kursk Incursion

description: Turkey’s Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan is set to attend informal talks with European Union counterparts on Aug. 29 for the first time in five years as the bloc works to improve ties with the country.
title: Turkey Hopes to Reset EU Ties With Rare Ministerial Meeting

description: Thousands of commuters in three of Canada’s biggest cities are scouring for alternate ways to work due to a labor dispute involving two of the country’s largest railways.
title: Toronto, Montreal Workers Scramble as Rail Strike Upends Commute

description: Indonesia’s parliament has decided against pursuing a controversial revision of regional election laws following fierce protests across the country that also rattled financial markets.
title: Indonesia Drops Plan to Revise Election Law After Protests

description: Former South African President Jacob Zuma was retained as the leader of the uMkhonto weSizwe Party, or MKP, which he started late last year, while ex-Judge John Hlophe was reappointed as his deputy.
title: South Africa’s MK Party Retains Zuma as Leader, Hlophe as Deputy

description: Hungary suggested it might start transporting migrants who show up at its border straight to Brussels unless it can resolve a dispute with the European Union on penalties for its asylum policies.
title: Hungary Threatens to Send Migrants to Brussels to Avenge EU Fine

description: Thailand became the first country in Asia to detect the new mutated strain of the mpox virus, as the pathogen spreads to more geographies after the World Health Organization declared the outbreak in Africa a new global health emergency.
title: Thailand Confirms Asia’s First Case of New Mpox Virus Strain

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Sleepwalking Into a Global Mpox Virus Calamity

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said India could play a crucial role in restoring peace in Ukraine following his meeting with Narendra Modi in Warsaw.
title: India Could Play Role in Restoring Ukraine Peace, Poland Says

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy visited his top general in a northeastern region bordering the area of Russia where his troops are fighting to expand the territory they’ve controlled for more than two weeks after a surprise attack.
title: Zelenskiy Visits Ukrainian Region Near Russian Incursion Area

description: Mercenaries from the Wagner Group are becoming more violent and killing more people one year after the death of the paramilitary group’s leader.
title: Russian Mercenaries Becoming More Deadly in Africa, Report Shows

description: The former Massachusetts governor talks about what Kamala Harris means for business and the Democratic Party.
title: Five Questions With Deval Patrick at the DNC

description: To hear people in the private equity industry talk publicly, there’s not a lot concern about any changes the UK’s new Labour government might make to a tax break they’ve enjoyed for the better part of four decades. Behind the scenes, though, the lobbying is intense.
title: Private Equity Fights for UK Tax Perk While Ducking Public Ire

description: The United Nations’ nuclear watchdog said it’s enormously concerned by fighting near a Russian nuclear power plant because the old Soviet reactors in operation are particularly exposed.
title: Nuclear Watchdog Sees Chernobyl-Style Risk at Kursk Reactor

description: Taiwan’s high court convicted eight people, including active-duty and retired military personnel, of collecting state secrets on behalf of China, the official Central News Agency reported, in one of the largest espionage cases in years.
title: Taiwan Jails Military Personnel on Charges of Spying for China

description: The promotion of a Chinese official disgraced for abusing Covid controls has sparked a fresh firestorm, prompting claims online that her elevation underscores ingrained institutional injustice.
title: China’s Promotion of Disgraced Covid Official Sparks Backlash

description: South Korean prosecutors looking into a luxury bag given to first lady Kim Keon Hee under questionable circumstances cleared the wife of President Yoon Suk Yeol of any criminal charge, Yonhap News said. She faced 12 hours of questioning in July, bringing new attention to the simmering incident that has dented support for the government. Yoon’s opponents have said the designer Dior bag was a bribe. Yoon and the first lady have denied any wrongdoing — saying the move was part of a “political maneu
title: Why a Dior Bag Given to the First Lady Caused a Stir in South Korean Politics

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Readers of the Balance of Power newsletter are also receiving this special edition in which Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green looks at what Tim Walz and Bill Clinton might have been aiming for last night. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Walz, Clinton Invite the Guys to Rejoin Democratic Team

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is scheduled to visit Ukraine on Friday, said he supports peace in the region and reiterated a call for diplomacy to end conflict.
title: Modi Calls for Peace, Diplomacy Ahead of His Visit to Ukraine

description: Canada’s two biggest railways, accounting for almost 80% of the national network, shut down early Thursday after talks with a union failed, immediately blocking arteries of North American supply chains that carry about C$1 billion ($740 million) per day in trade.
title: Canada Railways Lock Out Workers as Talks Fail, Snarling Trade

description: Taiwan will spend a record amount on defense next year, boosting its expenditure for eight straight years as it tries to deter an increasingly assertive China.
title: Taiwan Plans Record Military Spending as China Threat Looms

description: Indonesian lawmakers adjourned a meeting amid online and street protests against electoral changes that would effectively favor the alliance of President Joko Widodo and his successor, Prabowo Subianto.
title: Indonesian Parliament Adjourns as Protests Hit Markets

description: A third liquefied natural gas tanker appears to be heading to the Arctic LNG 2 export plant in northern Russia that’s subject to US sanctions, with Moscow ramping up efforts to circumvent Western restrictions.
title: Another ‘Dark Fleet’ Tanker Set for Sanctioned Russian LNG Plant

description: Brazil will start restricting the entry of citizens from countries including China and India in a bid to crack down on people arriving in the South American nation and then trying to illegally migrate to the US and Canada.
title: Brazil to Limit Some Visitors to Stem Illegal Migration to US
